lead_paragraph: Element 113 is credited to scientists from the Riken institute in Japan, who will bestow an official name more than 12 years after they began their efforts.
snippet: Element 113 is credited to scientists from the Riken institute in Japan, who will bestow an official name more than 12 years after they began their efforts.

headline.main: In a First, Element Will Be Named by Researchers in Japan

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Union of Pure and Applied Physics

abstract: Scientists from Riken institute in Japan will bestow official name on Element 113 in periodic table, upending tradition in which Europeans and Americans have monopolized process of naming elements; International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry says Japan has strongest claim to having discovered element.
